numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Rich applicants are more likely to be accepted than poor applicants.
2. Legacy applicants are more likely to be accepted than non-legacy applicants.
3. For legacy students, the acceptance rate increases when the family is wealthier.
4. For non-legacy students, the acceptance rate decreases and later increases.
5. For legacy students, the acceptance rate spikes at the 99.9th income rank.
6. For non-legacy students, the acceptance rate spikes at the 99.9th income rank.
7. At around the 85th income rank, the admission likelihood for non-legacy students drops below the average admissions rate.
8. I wonder why the admission likelihood for non-legacy students drops below the average admissions rate at around the 85th income rank.
9. I wonder if financial aid affects this drop.
10. I will apply to college soon.
11. This information relates to me because I will apply to college soon.
12. The college admissions process has discrimination.
13. This discrimination becomes more relevant over time.
14. The headline is: The Inequality in "Equally-Qualified" Students.
